page.title: 06THE RAILWAY AT KNOTTINGLEY.
page.content: Knottingley is on the Leeds Goole railway line.The steel rails lie on concrete sleepers and the sleepers sit on ballast.Lights control the trains.These work like traffic lights using the same colours. The trains are diesel trains. Most of the goods trains carry coal from the local pits to the local power stations.The railway station consists of two wooden platforms and a bridge to cross the lines.There is a small shelter on one of the platforms.Daily there are 12 passenger trains to Leeds and 5 to Goole.The journey to Leeds takes 41mins and to Goole 33mins.The passenger trains are called Pay Trains because you pay the guard when you get on the trains.
